Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Python class that implements an API server using Flask and gevent WSGI server, capable of serving web UI and handling REST API requests with proper error handling.

Class Description: APIServer is a class that encapsulates a Flask web server with gevent WSGI capabilities. It handles server lifecycle management, web UI serving, and error handling for REST API endpoints.

Attributes:
- stop_event: [Event] - A gevent event used to signal server shutdown
- config: [RestApiConfig] - Configuration object containing server settings (host, port, etc.)
- rest_api: [RestAPI] - Reference to the main REST API implementation
- wsgiserver: [Optional[WSGIServer]] - The gevent WSGI server instance
- flask_app: [Flask] - The Flask application instance

Methods:
- __init__(rest_api: "RestAPI", config: RestApiConfig, eth_rpc_endpoint: str = None) -> None - Initializes the API server with configuration and dependencies
- _serve_webui(file_name: str = "index.html") -> Response - Serves web UI files from configured directory (handles fallback to index.html)
- _run() -> None - Internal method to run the WSGI server indefinitely
- start() -> None - Starts the API server and initializes the WSGI server
- stop() -> None - Stops the API server gracefully
- unhandled_exception(exception: Exception) -> Response - Global exception handler that returns error responses and logs critical errors
